comment: She was not a good professor at all. Always went on irrelevant rants and her instructions were always unclear. She would consistently point people out and yell a lot. On top of all this, she is a tough and unfair grader. If you do take this class, make sure you attend every lecture. I was given 10 points to my overall grade for my attendance.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: Professor Salsi was honestly very sweet, but not a great teacher. Her classes consist of her ranting about things that have nothing to do with the class, and she expects you to understand what you are supposed to do even when her instructions are extremely unclear. Barely had any idea what of what was going on in the class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: She is a very good writer and knows what is written well and what isn't. The issue is that it doesn't translate to being a good professor. Class time was spent with her talking about her opinions and anecdotes that loosely connected to the point of the lecture. The class itself was quite disorganized and no one knew what was happening.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback

comment: The amount of reading she expected of us was ridiculous. She was rude to me out of nowhere, I am soft spoken and do not cause trouble. She made fun of my hair the second day of class. Lectures were always off topic, she talked about her personal life for 80% of the class and not the material. Grading and assignments were very unclear.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: This is the worst professor I have ever had. She spends most of the class going on tangents. Her syllabus is not helpful in letting you know when something is due. She is terrible at letting you know what assignments are due for the week until the last minute. Horrible communication. Didn't post grade once the entire semester. DO NOT TAKE
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Great teacher just wants you to learn. Gives a good amount of reading but all easy stuff.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: I loved this class so much! She gives tons of extra credit opportunities if you talk in class and make sure you read before so you are prepare. Make sure she knows who you are so at the end if you need help in your grade she will know that you tried to reach out to her. Just make sure you read and go to her lectures.

Took her in 2017. Amazing professor. Always had good feedback on papers and she was VERY understanding. Papers usually consisted of reading certain books/chapters and then writing summaries (longish)... but SparkNotes was pretty useful! To be fair, I don't mind writing, so if you HATE writing, maybe find another professor, due to paper amount.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--So many papers

comment: I would advise taking any other professor if able. Despite the class being a hybrid class, she never posted anything online. Attending class was pointless since we rarely discussed anything related to English. She mostly discussed her political views and personal accomplishments. She is very knowledgeable on English but teaching isnt for her.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: I have always gave professors 5 stars, but she was very difficult. She was extremly opinionated and wanted you to agree with her exactly. Didn't put in a single grade until the last day. Told me I know nothing a lot and said the only way I will get an A is if I become brilliant overnight. She does spend a lot of time helping her students though.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: Prof. Salsi always came to class with a good attitude. Definitely recommend her!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Group projects--Caring

comment: Professor Salsi is a good professor. She does give us lots of papers to do but doesn't have rubrics. So, it makes writing the papers a little difficult. However, she does give us papers back to rewrite them, and she tells us exactly how to fix them. She also has not posted or given us exact grades. So no one knows what they have in the class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--So many papers

comment: if you show up to class, she will care more about your grade and give you more feedback and allow you to fix your mistakes on essays, it was a hard class but the lectures would be about events going on in the world which made it interesting, she is a very intellectual professor, I learned a lot of writing skills in her class, no syllabus
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: No clear grading criteria. I felt sick walking to this class every day because it was so horrible. She will fail you if you miss more than 3 classes. She yelled at me and took off points because I used the word "claimed" even though that was the correct word to use. I ran into her at Taco Bell after class several times and nearly died every time.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: I dreaded coming to class because she constantly goes off topic and she talks to us as if were dumb. We had various rhetorical essays, a couple summaries and one 6 page paper. We also had to do a TED talk ,which she didnt pay much attention to. There werent any quizzes or test. Textbooks are pointless in this class as well as the book.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--So many papers

comment: 3 two page essays, occupational group in class questions, a ted talk presentation, and a 6 page final paper. A little all over the place on due dates, but if you can figure that out and turn everything in you should end up with at least a C if not a B. It was the only class I had where I had no idea what to expect when I walked in everyday.
rating_tags: So many papers--Tough grader

comment: This class is nothing more than a political/self interested rant. The professor loves to rant about her life and views and gives little to no information on assignments. Two of my essays were lost and never found and I have never dreaded a class more than this one. I highly advise against taking this professor as this a fundamental waste of time.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Do you like or major in political science? Then you'll at least get a kick out of this class. Do you want to learn basic English skills at a college level? Look somewhere else. Only talks about herself and politics all class period. Assigns books you never use, and makes you write papers she barley reads and grades harshly. Skip this professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--So many papers

comment: She did not give any assignments throughout the semester. She used class time to talk about herself and everything she has accomplished. She assigns a lot of reading assignments that she barely touches on in lecture, and never comes back too. In my class, whatever we made on the final was our grade in the glass. She did not keep track of anything.
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: Prof Salsi is a great writer who gives excellent advice, but I found her class hard to sit through. She would regularly go on political rants then get angry when we tried to speak up, or would scold us for being off topic. I'm not sure what was going on with the vibe of her class but most of us dreaded coming in.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: She is a good professor with a good background. However, she gets off topic very fast and there are many papers that have had nothing to do with each other. I do not feel as if this class was fair especially since my major is being deactivated and I needed this class to finish the program.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: she can be funny at times, but sometimes it gets annoying. she rambles A LOT, and it is hard for her to stay on topic. i hope you love writing because there are several rhetorical analysis that you have to write. there was one project on philanthropy but it was pretty easy
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: I loved Professor Salsi. You could tell she wanted everyone to pass the class. She grades a little tough, but her feedback is very helpful & really helps you form good long term writing habits. She really helped me become a better writer. She also gives you time to finish assignments and lets you text her any questions you have.
rating_tags: Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof Salsi is so sweet! She lets you text her or email her outside of class to revise papers. She definitely pays attention to participation and will give you a good grade if you are involved and interested. We get off topic a lot, so I'm not sure what is going on a lot of the time but she is so funny and sweet!
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS JUST TRUST ME
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: She is a tough grader but lets you fix your paper to get higher grades. At the end she has a portfolio that can help you raise your grade. She is very funny and nice and is one of the ones that knows what she is doing. Also gives extra credit. Definitely take her!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Tough Grader--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: She's a very nice lady but being a professor isn't her calling. I took her as a hybrid class and for the 1 1/2 hours I spent with her every week, she basically ranted about flying cars or some other nonsense until the last 10 minutes where she'd start describing our next assignment. She does make herself EXTREMELY accessible outside of class though
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Guys, she's a little crazy, but if you SPEAK to this woman she will literally tell you how to get an A. That being said, if you are not a strong writer you may have trouble because she is tough. But if you are good at papers, actually do your work she assigns, she let 1102 resubmit all of our papers are the end of the year as a "final."
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Attendance is required for her class but I don't understand why since she does not teach us anything. Mainly, she babbles about something random until class ends. She's a tough grader and gives a ton of assignments. I learned nothing from the class other than the fact she dislikes the word "like". Don't expect her to follow her own syllabus either.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She also did me wrong at the end of the semester. You will have so much hw and papers it's unreal. I kept up with everything and still ended with a C in the class. She picks favorites in each class and basically doesn't really teach you at all. She's super nice but not the best professor.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: She did me wrong at the end of the semester. I worked so hard on everything in her class and did well on everything, even getting a 95 on the final. However I ended up getting a B in the class. I was very disappointed, but more curious as to why  I got this grade. I sent her numerous emails which she proceeded to ignore. No respect for this woman
rating_tags: Tough Grader--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Buy her textbooks if you plan to pass, because most of her assignments incorporate these in some way. She will go off on tangents for 30-45 minutes and manage to tie it into the lecture somehow. Make friends with her, it will definitely be worth your while. Lots of writing but she's always willing to help, and ends up teaching you valuable info.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: First of all, I personally love this lady, but be prepared to learn little to nothing during class. This class is all about turning in a new writing assignment every single week. Four different 4+ page essays in the semester and numerous rhetorical analysis'. Class is always fun though. She tells lots of stories and makes it not feel like lecture.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Professor Salsi gives a lot of assignments but if you can manage time, she works with you. She gives great feedback and is always willing to review anything with you. Very accessible outside of class, likes to upload material onto D2L prior to class so definitely check it often. Overall a good professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS
